How can you determine how much your monster's stress/fatigue points are?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): How can you determine how much your monster's stress/fatigue points are?
By poko-poko on Monday, April 13, 2009 - 06:48 am:

I've been playing MR2 ever since I was 8, back then my monsters pretty much sucked... until I saw this site at age 11 and ever since I was able to raise good monsters. At some point my ps broke and I didn't get the chance to play again, until now... and now after constant reading from this site, I've decided to ask (see title). Ive seen topics stating an actual number of points of a monster's fatigue, stress, and even fear, respect, spoil. Is there a way to determine these or something. I've known this game for a very long time and yet I'm still quite new :)

By Lisa Shock on Monday, April 13, 2009 - 08:12 am:

You have to do the math every week starting when they are born. And, remember that it's all done by the game at the end of the week when the screen goes dark. You might want to look at *R*'s:

Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Raising/Training Methods: Designing a training method: An intellectual excercise

and

Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Raising/Training Methods: The Energizer Bunny Project (or: Building The Hare Of Tomorrow, Today)

For practical examples.
